snippet: A United States proposal to keep the Internet in the hands of the private sector is being resisted by some delegates, including those from Russia and some African and Middle Eastern nations.
abstract: United Nations delegates meeting to draft a treaty on the future of international telecommunications rebuff United States proposal that would exclude Internet companies as well as private and government networks; US has argued that including the Internet in such regulations would restrict its development.
lead_paragraph: A United States proposal to keep the Internet in the hands of the private sector is being resisted by some delegates, including those from Russia and some African and Middle Eastern nations.

headline.seo: Drafters of Communications Treaty Are Split on Internet Issue
headline.main: Drafters of Communications Treaty Are Split on Issue of Internet Governance
headline.print_headline: Drafters of Communications Treaty Are Split on Issue of Internet Governance

keywords.value: Internet Corp for Assigned Names and Numbers
keywords.name: organizations
